text:
I noticed something interesting comparing these two docker images:
```jupyter/datascience-notebook                                      latest               a665c8ddeb27   3 days ago     3.91GB
julia                                                             1.6.0-beta1-buster   8bebd5c999f5   2 weeks ago    484MB```
3.91GB vs. 484MB is quite a lot. If you add miniconda and jupyterlab to that julia image, it’s still just 1.14GB.
```julia-miniconda-jupyterlab                                        latest               5ab826013af0   About a minute ago   1.14GB```
This costs money if you store them in Google/Amazon registry.

```FROM julia:1.6.0-beta1-buster

USER root
RUN useradd -ms /bin/bash arthur
RUN apt-get update
RUN apt-get install -y wget && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

USER arthur
WORKDIR /home/arthur
ENV PATH="/home/arthur/miniconda3/bin:${PATH}"
ARG PATH="/home/arthur/miniconda3/bin:${PATH}"
RUN wget \
    <https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh> \
    && mkdir /home/arthur/.conda \
    && bash Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh -b \
    && rm -f Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh 
RUN conda install -y jupyterlab

CMD /bin/bash```
